areaSection: Orihuela Costa sits on the southern edge of the Costa Blanca, a 7-kilometer stretch of Mediterranean shoreline blessed with 320 days of annual sunshine. Between the charming towns of Playa Flamenca and Cabo Roig, this area has evolved into a sophisticated resort destination while maintaining authentic Spanish character. The landscape features dramatic coastline, protected dunes, and exclusive golf developments nestled inland. Entre golf, your property's neighborhood, is particularly prized for its proximity to five championship golf courses and easy access to some of the coast's finest beaches. The area combines resort-style amenities with genuine residential appeal—this isn't a crowded tourist strip but a well-established community where families and holiday makers coexist seamlessly. The southern location means warmer winters than Costa Blanca North, making it ideal for those escaping northern European winters.
lifestyleSection: Life in Orihuela Costa revolves around a magnificent blend of leisure and comfort. Your morning might include a round at one of five nearby golf courses, lunch at beachfront restaurants in Cabo Roig, and an evening stroll through the weekly markets at La Zenia Boulevard. The community is remarkably cosmopolitan—strong British, Scandinavian, and Dutch populations mean English is widely spoken, international restaurants thrive, and expatriate friendship networks form naturally. Shopping is excellent with Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl for daily essentials, plus the substantial La Zenia Boulevard for retail and dining. Beaches are genuinely walkable for most residents—La Zenia, Campoamor, and Playa Flamenca all feature Blue Flag status, meaning exceptional water quality and lifeguard-patrolled swimming. Healthcare is comprehensive with English-speaking doctors readily available. The slower pace compared to urban Spain means you'll experience authentic relaxation without sacrificing modern conveniences. It's the lifestyle of permanent vacation without the vacation-rental chaos.

faqs.question: What are the annual costs of owning this property?
faqs.answer: Annual ownership costs typically include: community fees (€1,500-2,000 annually for maintenance and amenities), Spanish property tax (IBI approximately €350-400 annually based on property value), and optional utilities (electricity, water, internet €100-150 monthly when occupied). Holiday rental properties may claim tax deductions against rental income. Buildings insurance costs approximately €150-250 annually. Total annual costs without utilities typically range €2,200-2,800 for unoccupied periods, offset substantially by holiday rental income.

faqs.question: What's included in the community fees?
faqs.answer: Community fees cover maintenance of shared facilities, security and controlled access systems, communal gardens, parking area upkeep, street lighting, and common area insurance. Established developments like Entre golf maintain high standards ensuring property values and desirability. Fees typically include 24-hour access control and maintenance of community amenities. Community annual meetings provide transparent budgeting and expense accountability. Reserve funds ensure significant repairs don't trigger special assessments to individual owners.

faqs.question: How is the local food and restaurant scene?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Orihuela Costa boasts diverse dining from authentic Spanish tapas bars to international cuisine serving expatriate communities. Seafood restaurants along Cabo Roig harbor command spectacular Mediterranean views with fresh fish daily. La Zenia Boulevard restaurants offer contemporary Spanish, Italian, Asian, and British cuisines. Weekly farmers markets provide fresh Mediterranean produce, seafood, and artisanal products at excellent value. Chiringuitos (beach bars) serve paella and fresh fish with barefoot casualness. Michelin-recognized restaurants operate within 30 minutes for special occasions.

faqs.question: What's the best time to visit or stay at this property?
faqs.answer: May through September offers peak weather (28-32°C) and maximum beach/golf activity, though July-August brings highest rental rates and tourist density. September-October provides ideal conditions—summer warmth (24-27°C) with substantially fewer tourists and lower rental competition. November through March features mild winters (15-20°C) perfect for golf and outdoor activities, with exceptional accommodation deals. April combines excellent weather with spring renewal energy. Year-round sunshine makes any season viable; personal preference should guide visit timing.
